column4: UPDATE 1-MOVES-Goldman Sachs names new investment banking heads in Asia
column5: HONG KONG  May 26 Goldman Sachs has named Andrea Vella and Kate Richdale as its new co-heads of investment banking in Asia excluding Japan  according to an internal memo  replacing Matthew Westerman who will transfer to a senior role in London.

column4: MOVES--Goldman Sachs names new investment banking heads in Asia
column5: HONG KONG  May 26 Goldman Sachs has named Kate Richdale and Andrea Vella as its new co-heads of investment banking in Asia excluding Japan  according to an internal memo seen by Reuters on Tuesday.

column4: UPDATE 2-Nigerian oil union halts Halliburton operation over job cuts
column5: LAGOS  May 26 Nigeria's main oil union has shut down the local operations of U.S. oilfield services provider Halliburton Co in protest against job cuts  the trade body said on Tuesday.

column4: Nigerian oil union shuts down Halliburton operation over job cuts
column5: LAGOS  May 26 Nigeria's main oil union has shut down the local operations of U.S. oilfield services provider Halliburton Co. in protest against job cuts  the trade body said on Tuesday.

column4: Oil rally drives producer hedging
column5: NEW YORK  May 26 (IFR) - A rally in oil prices that has pushed WTI spot levels above US$60 has drawn a spate of hedging activity as producers look to lock in 2016 cashflows.

column4: UPDATE 1-Hormel Foods to buy organic meat company Applegate
column5: May 26 Hormel Foods Corp said it would buy natural and organic meat processor Applegate Farms LLC for about $775 million to cater to an increasing demand for food free of antibiotics  hormones and artificial additives.

column4: Hormel Foods to buy organic meat company Applegate for $775 million
column5: Hormel Foods Corp   the maker of Spam lunch meat  said it would buy meat processor Applegate Farms LLC for about $775 million to expand its natural and organic meat products.

column4: Hormel Foods to buy organic meat company Applegate for $775 mln
column5: May 26 Hormel Foods Corp  the maker of Spam lunch meat  said it would buy meat processor Applegate Farms LLC for about $775 million to expand its natural and organic meat products.

column4: Swiss lawmakers satisfied with oversight of HSBC Swiss bank
column5: ZURICH/GENEVA Swiss lawmakers are satisfied with the country's financial watchdog's oversight of HSBC Holdings PLC's Swiss arm  a parliamentary subcommittee said on Tuesday.

column4: Rockfall traps nine miners in IAMGOLD mine in Quebec
column5: May 26 Rescuers were clearing rocks to free nine miners trapped more than half a mile (1 km) underground at IAMGOLD Corp's Westwood gold mine in Quebec on Tuesday after a rockfall  a company spokesman said.

column4: U.S. top court backs contractor KBR in Iraq whistleblower case
column5: WASHINGTON The Supreme Court on Tuesday handed a victory to defense contractor KBR Inc in its legal fight with a former employee who filed a whistleblower suit accusing it of defrauding the U.S. government over water purification work in Iraq.

column4: U.S. top court backs contractor KBR in Iraq whistleblower case
column5: WASHINGTON The Supreme Court on Tuesday handed a victory to defense contractor KBR Inc in its legal fight with a former employee who filed a whistleblower suit accusing it of defrauding the U.S. government over water purification work in Iraq.

column4: UPDATE 2-U.S. top court backs contractor KBR in Iraq whistleblower case
column5: WASHINGTON  May 26 The Supreme Court on Tuesday handed a victory to defense contractor KBR Inc in its legal fight with a former employee who filed a whistleblower suit accusing it of defrauding the U.S. government over water purification work in Iraq.

column4: U.S. Air Force certifies SpaceX for national security launches
column5: WASHINGTON The U.S. Air Force on Tuesday said it has certified privately held SpaceX to launch U.S. military and spy satellites  ending a monopoly held by United Launch Alliance  a joint venture of Lockheed Martin Corp and Boeing Co  since its creation in 2006.

column4: UPDATE 3-U.S. Air Force certifies SpaceX for national security launches
column5: WASHINGTON  May 26 The U.S. Air Force on Tuesday said it has certified privately held SpaceX to launch U.S. military and spy satellites  ending a monopoly held by United Launch Alliance  a joint venture of Lockheed Martin Corp  and Boeing Co  since its creation in 2006.

column4: MIDEAST STOCKS-Gulf moves little but Saudi's Ma'aden surges to record
column5: * Ma'aden hits record high on bullish production  earnings outlook

column4: UPDATE 2-FTSE takes cautious steps to including China-listed shares in benchmark
column5: * China A shares may be included in key benchmark in two years

column4: UPDATE 2-MIDEAST STOCKS-Almarai  Ma'aden lift Saudi; Egypt slips
column5: DUBAI  May 26 Saudi Arabia's stock market rose in early trade on Tuesday  supported by industrial blue chips  while Egypt's bourse slipped as index compiler MSCI prepared to reduce the country's weighting in its emerging markets index.

column4: Truckers' secret to fuel efficiency: take it easy
column5: EAST DUBUQUE  Illinois Mario Enriquez says there’s no real trick to getting great fuel mileage in a big truck.

column4: Australia's gold miners drive M&A revival
column5: SYDNEY  May 26 Gold miners are spearheading a wave of merger and acquisition activity in Australia  riding a rebound in local gold prices to pounce on projects promising quick growth.

column4: TD Bank to buy Nordstrom's U.S. consumer credit card portfolio
column5: TORONTO Toronto Dominion Bank  said on Tuesday it will acquire Nordstrom's  U.S. consumer credit card portfolio as the Canadian bank looks to use its strong balance sheet to expand its lending business in the United States.

column4: TD Bank to buy Nordstrom's U.S. consumer credit card portfolio
column5: TORONTO  May 26 Toronto Dominion Bank  said on Tuesday it will acquire Nordstrom's U.S. consumer credit card portfolio as the Canadian bank looks to use its strong balance sheet to expand its lending business in the United States.

column4: Obama administration asks U.S. top court to decline Google copyright appeal
column5: WASHINGTON/SAN FRANCISCO The Obama administration on Tuesday sided against Google Inc and said the U.S. Supreme Court should not hear the company's appeal in a case against Oracle Corp with wide implications for the technology industry  according to a court filing.

column4: UPDATE 2-Obama administration asks U.S. top court to decline Google copyright appeal
column5: WASHINGTON/SAN FRANCISCO  May 26 The Obama administration on Tuesday sided against Google Inc and said the U.S. Supreme Court should not hear the company's appeal in a case against Oracle Corp with wide implications for the technology industry  according to a court filing.

column4: Former Petrobras executive sentenced to five years jail
column5: SAO PAULO  May 26 A Brazilian judge sentenced a former international director at state-run oil firm Petroleo Brasileiro SA to five years in prison for money laundering on Tuesday  the second  company executive convicted in an ongoing corruption probe.

column4: L'Oreal not interested in Wella - executive tells Handelsblatt
column5: PARIS  May 26 L'Oreal is not interested in buying Procter & Gamble Co's Wella haircare business  the head of the French cosmetics group's luxury division told German daily Handelsblatt in an interview.

column4: PRESS DIGEST- Financial Times - May 26
column5: May 26 The following are the top stories in the Financial Times. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

column4: Britain's FTSE falls  energy and banking stocks weigh
column5: LONDON  May 26 Britain's top equity index fell on Tuesday  with banking stocks coming under pressure after regional election results in Spain  put euro zone financials on the back foot  and energy shares tracking weaker crude oil prices.

column4: Banking and energy shares drag down FTSE index
column5: LONDON  May 26 Britain's top equity index fell on Tuesday  with banking stocks coming under pressure after regional election results in Spain  put euro zone financials on the back foot  and energy shares tracking weaker crude oil prices.

column4: BRIEF-NeuroVive teams up with Sanofi for Ciclomulsion launch in South Korea
column5: * NeuroVive Asia signs collaboration agreement with Sanofi for the development and commercialization of ciclomulsion in South Korea

column4: UPDATE 4-Hundreds more oil sands staff evacuated on Alberta fire threat
column5: CALGARY  Alberta  May 26 Statoil ASA  MEG Energy Corp and Cenovus Energy Inc  evacuated hundreds of workers from three oil sands projects in northeastern Alberta on Tuesday as wildfires raged through the key crude-producing region.

column4: UPDATE 2-Tata Motors net profit down 56 pct as Jaguar Land Rover Chinese sales drop
column5: * Analyst estimates forex loss of about 220 mln pounds   (Adds executive comment  details)

column4: India's Tata Motors net profit falls 56 pct  misses estimates
column5: NEW DELHI  May 26 Tata Motors Ltd  India's biggest automaker by revenue  reported a drop in quarterly net profit due to a spike in costs despite steady sales of its luxury Jaguar Land Rover unit and an increase in demand for its cars in its home market.

column4: Telecom Italia tower unit could be worth up to $2.8 bln - banks
column5: MILAN  May 26 Italian tower company Inwit is worth up to 2.6 billion euros  ($2.8 billion)  Mediobanca Securities and Banca IMI said in research notes published before the Telecom Italia unit launches its initial public offering next month.

column4: Bulgaria's BEH considers $550 mln loan to pay AES  ContourGlobal
column5: SOFIA  May 26 Bulgaria's state-owned energy holding company BEH is considering  a syndicated loan of about 1 billion levs  ($557.66 million) to pay back delayed dues to two U.S. thermal power producers in the country  Deputy Energy Minister Nikolai Nikolov said on Tuesday.

column4: PHILIPPINES PRESS-AES may bid for Malampaya banked gas - Standard
column5: AES Philippines  the local unit of AES Corp  may bid for the Malampaya banked gas in northwest Palawan  its first natural gas project in the country  The Standard reported  citing AES Philippines Managing Director Neeraj Bhat.

column4: Deals of the day-Mergers and acquisitions
column5: May 26 The following bids  mergers  acquisitions and disposals were reported by 2000 GMT on Tuesday:

column4: TD Bank to buy Nordstrom's U.S. consumer credit card portfolio
column5: TORONTO  May 26 Toronto Dominion Bank  said on Tuesday it will acquire Nordstrom's U.S. consumer credit card portfolio as the Canadian bank looks to use its strong balance sheet to expand its lending business in the United States.

column4: Pension adviser says Ernst & Young was aware of Wal-Mart Mexico bribery allegations
column5: A labor-affiliated pension fund adviser is seeking an inquest into the auditor of Wal Mart Stores Inc   Ernst & Young LLP  accusing the auditing firm of knowing about possible bribery in Mexico long before the retailer disclosed it to U.S. authorities.

column4: Pension adviser says Ernst & Young was aware of Wal-Mart Mexico bribery allegations
column5: May 25 A labor-affiliated pension fund adviser is seeking an inquest into the auditor of Wal Mart Stores Inc   Ernst & Young LLP  accusing the auditing firm of knowing about possible bribery in Mexico long before the retailer disclosed it to U.S. authorities.

column4: Fitch Downgrades Xinyuan to 'B' from 'B+'; Outlook Stable
column5: - EBITDA margin falling below 15% on a sustained basis Positive future developments that may  individually or collectively  lead to  positive rating action include: - Significant increase in scale as reflected by contracted sales exceeding  CNY15bn - Net debt/adjusted inventory falling below 40% on a sustained basis - Contracted sales/total debt improving to above 1.0x on a sustained basis
